134/**
135 *  The annotation processor for the {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.config}
136 *  module.
137 *
138 *  @version $Id: ConfigAnnotationProcessor.java 946 2021-12-23 14:48:19Z tquadrat $
139 *
140 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
141 *  @UMLGraph.link
142 *  @since 0.1.0
143 */
144@SuppressWarnings( {"OverlyCoupledClass", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
145@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ConfigAnnotationProcessor.java 946 2021-12-23 14:48:19Z tquadrat $" )
146@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
147@SupportedSourceVersion( SourceVersion.RELEASE_17 )
148@SupportedOptions( { APBase.ADD_DEBUG_OUTPUT, APBase.MAVEN_GOAL } )
149public class ConfigAnnotationProcessor extends APBase

514        /*---------*\
515    ====** Methods **==========================================================
516        \*---------*/
517    /**
518     *  Checks whether the given type name is inappropriate for a configuration
519     *  bean property and deserves that an
520     *  {@link InappropriateTypeError}
521     *  is thrown.
522     *
523     *  @param  typeName    The type name to check.
524     *  @throws InappropriateTypeError  The given type may not be chosen for
525     *      a configuration bean property.
526     *
527     *  @see    InputStream
528     *  @see    Stream
529     *  @see    DoubleStream
530     *  @see    IntStream
531     *  @see    LongStream
532     */
533    private static final void checkAppropriate( final TypeName typeName ) throws InappropriateTypeError
534    {
535        if( !(typeName.isPrimitive() || typeName.isBoxedPrimitive()) )
536        {
537            //---* InputStream and the "primitive" Streams are not allowed *---
538            if( typeName.equals( TypeName.from( DoubleStream.class ) )
539                || typeName.equals( TypeName.from( IntStream.class ) )
540                || typeName.equals( TypeName.from( LongStream.class ) )
541                || typeName.equals( TypeName.from( InputStream.class ) ) )
542            {
543                throw new InappropriateTypeError( typeName );
544            }
545
546            //noinspection ChainOfInstanceofChecks
547            if( typeName instanceof ParameterizedTypeName parameterizedTypeName )
548            {
549                //---* Stream is not allowed *---------------------------------
550                if( parameterizedTypeName.rawType().equals( TypeName.from( Stream.class ) ) )
551                {
552                    throw new InappropriateTypeError( typeName );
553                }
554            }
555
556            /*
557             * Classes that are derived from InputStream or implement stream
558             * are not allowed.
559             */
560            if( typeName instanceof ClassName className )
561            {
562                loadClass( className.canonicalName() ).ifPresent( c ->
563                {
564                    if( Stream.class.isAssignableFrom( c ) || InputStream.class.isAssignableFrom( c ) )
565                    {
566                        throw new InappropriateTypeError( typeName );
567                    }
568                } );
569            }
570        }
571    }   //  checkAppropriate()
572
573    /**
574     *  <p>{@summary Composes an argument name from the given formal
575     *  parameter.}</p>
576     *  <p>Setters and 'add' methods use internal variables whose names can
577     *  conflict with the names of the formal parameters, as the latter can be
578     *  chosen freely by the user. Therefore this method will prefix the given
579     *  formal parameter name with &quot;{@code ;_$}&quot; to avoid any
580     *  possible collision.</p>
581     *
582     *  @param  parameter   The formal parameter.
583     *  @return The argument name.
584     */
585    private static final String composeArgumentName( final VariableElement parameter )
586    {
587        final var retValue = composeArgumentName( requireNonNullArgument( parameter, "parameter" ).getSimpleName() );
588
589        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
590        return retValue;
591    }   //  composeArgumentName()
592
593    /**
594     *  <p>{@summary Composes an argument name from the given formal
595     *  parameter.}</p>
596     *  <p>Setters and 'add' methods use internal variables whose names can
597     *  conflict with the names of the formal parameters, as the latter can be
598     *  chosen freely by the user. Therefore this method will prefix the given
599     *  formal parameter name with &quot;{@code ;_$}&quot; to avoid any
600     *  possible collision.</p>
601     *
602     *  @param  parameter   The formal parameter.
603     *  @return The argument name.
604     */
605    private static final String composeArgumentName( final CharSequence parameter )
606    {
607        final var retValue = format( "_$%s", requireNotEmptyArgument( parameter, "parameter" ) );
608
609        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
610        return retValue;
611    }   //  composeArgumentName()
612
613    /**
614     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the name of the property from the name of the
615     *  given executable element for a method that is either a getter, a setter
616     *  or an 'add' method.}</p>
617     *  <p>Alternatively the method has an annotation that provides the name of
618     *  the property.</p>
619     *
620     *  @param  method  The method.
621     *  @return The name of the property.
622     *
623     *  @see PropertyName
624     *  @see SpecialProperty
625     *  @see SpecialPropertyType
626     */
627    private final String determinePropertyNameFromMethod( @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" ) final ExecutableElement method )
628    {
629        final String retValue;
630        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = method.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
631        final var propertyNameAnnotation = method.getAnnotation( PropertyName.class );
632        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
633        {
634            if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
635            {
636                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, PropertyName.class.getName(), method.getSimpleName() ) );
637            }
638            final var specialPropertyType = specialPropertyAnnotation.value();
639            retValue = specialPropertyType.getPropertyName();
640        }
641        else
642        {
643            if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
644            {
645                retValue = propertyNameAnnotation.value();
646            }
647            else
648            {
649                final var methodName = method.getSimpleName().toString();
650
651                /*
652                 * We know that the method is either a getter, a setter or an 'add'
653                 * method. Therefore, we know also that the name starts either with
654                 * "get", "set", "add" or "is".
655                 */
656                final var pos = methodName.startsWith( PREFIX_IS ) ? PREFIX_IS.length() : PREFIX_GET.length();
657                retValue = decapitalize( methodName.substring( pos ) );
658            }
659        }
660
661        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
662        return retValue;
663    }   //  determinePropertyNameFromMethod()
664
665    /**
666     *  <p>{@summary Determines the property type from the return type of the
667     *  given getter.}</p>
668     *  <p>Usually this will be the return type as is, only in case of
669     *  {@link Optional},
670     *  it will be the parameter type.</p>
671     *
672     *  @param  getter  The getter to inspect.
673     *  @return The property type.
674     */
675    private static final TypeName determinePropertyType( final ExecutableElement getter )
676    {
677        var retValue = TypeName.from( requireNonNullArgument( getter, "getter" ).getReturnType() );
678        if( retValue instanceof ParameterizedTypeName returnType )
679        {
680            if( returnType.rawType().equals( TypeName.from( Optional.class ) ) )
681            {
682                retValue = returnType.typeArguments().get( 0 );
683            }
684        }
685
686        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
687        return retValue;
688    }   //  determinePropertyType()
689
690    /**
691     *  {@inheritDoc}
692     */
693    @Override
694    protected final Collection<Class<? extends Annotation>> getSupportedAnnotationClasses()
695    {
696        final Collection<Class<? extends Annotation>> retValue = List.of( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class, MessagePrefix.class, BaseBundleName.class );
697
698        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
699        return retValue;
700    }   //  getSupportedAnnotationClasses()
701
702    /**
703     *  Processes the given
704     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
705     *  instance for an 'add' method.
706     *
707     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
708     *  @param  addMethod   The 'add' method.
709     */
710    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
711    private final void handleAddMethod( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement addMethod )
712    {
713        //---* Get the method name *-------------------------------------------
714        final var addMethodName = addMethod.getSimpleName();
715
716        //---* Check for unwanted annotations *--------------------------------
717        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
718        Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
719        {
720            SystemProperty.class,
721            EnvironmentVariable.class,
722            SystemPreference.class,
723            Preference.class,
724            NoPreference.class,
725            Argument.class,
726            Option.class,
727            INIValue.class
728        };
729        for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
730        {
731            if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
732            {
733                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnAddMethod, annotationClass.getName(), addMethodName ) );
734            }
735        }
736
737        /*
738         * If the 'add' method is default, our job is mostly done already.
739         */
740        final var isDefault = addMethod.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
741        if( isDefault )
742        {
743            //noinspection unchecked
744            unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
745                {
746                    CheckEmpty.class,
747                    CheckNull.class,
748                    SpecialProperty.class
749                };
750            for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
751            {
752                if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
753                {
754                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnAddMethod, annotationClass.getName(), addMethodName ) );
755                }
756            }
757        }
758        else
759        {
760            //---* Get the property name *-------------------------------------
761            final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( addMethod );
762
763            /*
764             * As we cannot infer the property type from an add method, it is
765             * required that we already have a property specification for this
766             * property.
767             */
768            @SuppressWarnings( "CastToConcreteClass" )
769            final var property = (PropertySpecImpl) configuration.getProperty( propertyName )
770                .orElseThrow( () -> new org.tquadrat.foundation.ap.CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_MissingPropertyDefinition, propertyName, addMethodName ) ) );
771
772            //---* Only collections may have 'add' methods *-------------------
773            if( property.getCollectionKind() == NO_COLLECTION )
774            {
775                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoCollection, addMethodName, propertyName ) );
776            }
777
778            //---* Immutable special properties may not have an add method *---
779            if( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
780            {
781                property.getSpecialPropertyType()
782                    .map( CodeGenerator::getSpecialPropertySpecification )
783                    .filter( spec -> spec.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE ) )
784                    .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalMutator, propertyName ) ) );
785            }
786
787            //---* Save the method name and variable name *--------------------
788            property.setAddMethodName( addMethodName );
789            final var argumentName = composeArgumentName( addMethod.getParameters().get( 0 ) );
790            property.setAddMethodArgumentName( argumentName );
791
792            //---* We have an add method, so the property is mutable *---------
793            property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
794            if( configuration.getSynchronizationRequired() ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION );
795
796            /*
797             * For a special property, all the definitions are made there, so
798             * nothing to do here â¦
799             */
800            if( !property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
801            {
802                final var propertyType = property.getPropertyType();
803                if( isNull( propertyType ) )
804                {
805                    throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoType, addMethodName, propertyName ) );
806                }
807
808                /*
809                 * 'add' methods are only allowed (useful?) for properties that are
810                 * collections.
811                 */
812                if( CollectionKind.determine( propertyType ) == NO_COLLECTION )
813                {
814                    throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_AddMethodNotAllowed, addMethodName ) );
815                }
816
817                /*
818                 * Get the StringConverter; as this cannot be inferred it has to be
819                 * taken from the annotation @StringConversion, if present. And
820                 * then it will override the already set one.
821                 */
822                configuration.extractStringConverterClass( addMethod )
823                    .ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass );
824            }
825
826            /*
827             * Shall the property be added to the result of toString()?
828             */
829            if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
830            {
831                property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
832            }
833
834            //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *-----------------------
835            final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer().overridingMethodBuilder( addMethod )
836                .addAnnotation( Override.class );
837            property.setAddMethodBuilder( methodBuilder );
838        }
839    }   //  handleAddMethod()
840
841    /**
842     *  Processes the given
843     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
844     *  instance for a getter method.
845     *
846     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
847     *  @param  getter  The getter method.
848     */
849    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
850    private final void handleGetter( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement getter )
851    {
852        //---* Get the property name *-----------------------------------------
853        final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( getter );
854
855        /*
856         * Create the new property spec and store it. The getters will be
857         * created first, so a property with the same name, defined by another
858         * getter, may not exist already. The respective check is made on
859         * storing.
860         */
861        final var property = new PropertySpecImpl( propertyName );
862        configuration.addProperty( property );
863
864        //---* Keep the name of the getter method *----------------------------
865        final var getterMethodName = getter.getSimpleName();
866        property.setGetterMethodName( getterMethodName );
867
868        //---* Shall the property be added to the result of toString()? *------
869        if( nonNull( getter.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
870        {
871            property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
872        }
873
874        //---* Default getters are handled differently *-----------------------
875        final var isDefault = getter.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
876        if( isDefault )
877        {
878            /*
879             * Several annotations are not allowed for a default getter.
880             */
881            @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
882            final Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
883            {
884                SystemProperty.class,
885                EnvironmentVariable.class,
886                SystemPreference.class,
887                Argument.class,
888                Option.class,
889                Preference.class,
890                SpecialProperty.class,
891                INIValue.class
892            };
893            for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
894            {
895                if( nonNull( getter.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
896                {
897                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, annotationClass.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
898                }
899            }
900            property.setFlag( GETTER_IS_DEFAULT );
901        }
902        var allowsPreferences = !isDefault;
903
904        /*
905         * Some properties are 'special', and that is reflected by the
906         * annotation @SpecialProperty.
907         */
908        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
909        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
910        {
911            /*
912             * No further analysis required because everything is determined by
913             * the special property spec, even the property name.
914             */
915            property.setSpecialPropertyType( specialPropertyAnnotation.value() );
916        }
917        else
918        {
919            //---* Determine the return type *---------------------------------
920            final var returnType = TypeName.from( getter.getReturnType() );
921            checkAppropriate( returnType );
922            property.setGetterReturnType( returnType );
923
924            //---* Determine the property type *-------------------------------
925            final var propertyType = determinePropertyType( getter );
926            checkAppropriate( propertyType );
927            property.setPropertyType( propertyType );
928            final var collectionKind = CollectionKind.determine( propertyType );
929            property.setCollectionKind( collectionKind );
930
931            /*
932             * Check whether the return type is Optional; only when the return
933             * type is Optional, it can be different from the property type.
934             */
935            if( !returnType.equals( propertyType ) ) property.setFlag( GETTER_RETURNS_OPTIONAL );
936
937            /*
938             * Determine the string converter instance, either from the
939             * annotation or guess it from the property type.
940             */
941            configuration.determineStringConverterClass( getter, propertyType ).ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass );
942
943            //---* Additional annotations *------------------------------------
944            final Optional<INIValue> iniValue = property.getStringConverterClass().isPresent()
945                ? Optional.ofNullable( getter.getAnnotation( INIValue.class ) )
946                : Optional.empty();
947            iniValue.ifPresent( a ->
948                {
949                    property.setINIConfiguration( a );
950                    property.setFlag( ALLOWS_INIFILE, PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
951                } );
952            allowsPreferences &= iniValue.isEmpty();
953
954            final var systemPropertyAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SystemProperty.class );
955            if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) )
956            {
957                if( iniValue.isPresent() )
958                {
959                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, INIValue.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
960                }
961
962                /*
963                 * The property will be initialised from a system property with
964                 * the name given in the annotation.
965                 */
966                property.setSystemPropertyName( systemPropertyAnnotation.value() );
967
968                /*
969                 * System properties may not be stored to/retrieved from
970                 * preferences or an INIFile.
971                 */
972                allowsPreferences = false;
973            }
974
975            final var environmentVariableAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( EnvironmentVariable.class );
976            if( nonNull( environmentVariableAnnotation ) )
977            {
978                if( iniValue.isPresent() )
979                {
980                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, INIValue.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
981                }
982
983                /*
984                 * @SystemProperty and @EnvironmentVariable are mutual
985                 * exclusive.
986                 */
987                if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) )
988                {
989                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, EnvironmentVariable.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
990                }
991
992                /*
993                 * The property will be initialised from an environment
994                 * variable with the name given in the annotation.
995                 */
996                property.setEnvironmentVariableName( environmentVariableAnnotation.value() );
997
998                /*
999                 * Environment variable values may not be stored
1000                 * to/retrieved from preferences.
1001                 */
1002                allowsPreferences = false;
1003            }
1004
1005            final var systemPrefsAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SystemPreference.class );
1006            if( nonNull( systemPrefsAnnotation ) )
1007            {
1008                /*
1009                 * @INIValue, @SystemProperty, @EnvironmentVariable and
1010                 * @SystemPreference are mutual exclusive.
1011                 */
1012                if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) || nonNull( environmentVariableAnnotation ) || iniValue.isPresent() )
1013                {
1014                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, SystemPreference.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1015                }
1016
1017                /*
1018                 * The property will be initialised from an environment
1019                 * variable with the name given in the annotation.
1020                 */
1021                property.setSystemPrefsPath( systemPrefsAnnotation.path() );
1022                final var prefsKey = systemPrefsAnnotation.key();
1023                if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefsKey ) )
1024                {
1025                    property.setPrefsKey( prefsKey );
1026                }
1027                else
1028                {
1029                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_PrefsKeyMissing, propertyName ) );
1030                }
1031
1032                final var accessorClass = getAnnotationMirror( getter, SystemPreference.class )
1033                    .flatMap( mirror -> getAnnotationValue( mirror, "accessor" ) )
1034                    .map( annotationValue -> TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() ) )
1035                    .orElseThrow( () -> new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_AccessorMissing, propertyName ) ) );
1036                property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1037
1038                /*
1039                 * System preference values may not be stored to/retrieved from
1040                 * preferences.
1041                 */
1042                allowsPreferences = false;
1043            }
1044
1045            //---* Process the CLI annotations *-------------------------------
1046            final var argumentAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Argument.class );
1047            final var optionAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Option.class );
1048            if( nonNull( argumentAnnotation) && nonNull( optionAnnotation ) )
1049            {
1050                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_CLIAnnotationClash, optionAnnotation );
1051            }
1052            if( nonNull( argumentAnnotation ) )
1053            {
1054                parseArgumentAnnotation( argumentAnnotation, getter, property );
1055            }
1056            if( nonNull( optionAnnotation ) )
1057            {
1058                parseOptionAnnotation( optionAnnotation, getter, property );
1059            }
1060
1061            //---* Process the preferences annotations *-----------------------
1062            final var noPreferenceAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( NoPreference.class );
1063            final var preferenceAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Preference.class );
1064            if( !allowsPreferences && nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1065            {
1066                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, Preference.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1067            }
1068            if( nonNull(  preferenceAnnotation ) && nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1069            {
1070                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_PreferenceAnnotationClash, noPreferenceAnnotation );
1071            }
1072            if( nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) ) allowsPreferences = false;
1073            if( allowsPreferences )
1074            {
1075                property.setFlag( ALLOWS_PREFERENCES );
1076
1077                //---* The default values *------------------------------------
1078                var preferenceKey = propertyName;
1079                var accessorClass = PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1080
1081                //---* Check the annotation *----------------------------------
1082                if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1083                {
1084                    if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( preferenceAnnotation.key() ) ) preferenceKey = preferenceAnnotation.key();
1085
1086                    try
1087                    {
1088                        final var name = "accessor";
1089                        accessorClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( getter, Preference.class, name )
1090                            .map( TypeName::from )
1091                            .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, Preference.class.getName(), name ) ) );
1092                    }
1093                    catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1094                    {
1095                        throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, Preference.class.getName() ), e );
1096                    }
1097                }
1098
1099                //---* Translate the default, if required *--------------------
1100                accessorClass = retrieveAccessorClass( accessorClass, propertyType );
1101
1102                //---* Keep the values *---------------------------------------
1103                property.setPrefsKey( preferenceKey );
1104                property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1105            }
1106
1107            //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *-------------------
1108            final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer().overridingMethodBuilder( getter )
1109                .addAnnotation( Override.class );
1110            property.setGetterBuilder( methodBuilder );
1111        }
1112    }   //  handleGetter()
1113
1114    /**
1115     *  Processes the given
1116     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
1117     *  instance for a setter method.
1118     *
1119     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
1120     *  @param  setter  The setter method.
1121     */
1122    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1123    private final void handleSetter( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement setter )
1124    {
1125        //---* Get the method name *-------------------------------------------
1126        final var setterMethodName = setter.getSimpleName();
1127
1128        //---* Check for unwanted annotations *--------------------------------
1129        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
1130        final Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
1131        {
1132            SystemProperty.class,
1133            EnvironmentVariable.class,
1134            SystemPreference.class,
1135            Argument.class,
1136            Option.class,
1137            INIValue.class
1138        };
1139        for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
1140        {
1141            if( nonNull( setter.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
1142            {
1143                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, annotationClass.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1144            }
1145        }
1146
1147        //---* Get the property name *-----------------------------------------
1148        final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( setter );
1149
1150        /*
1151         * Let's see if we have such a property already; if not, we have to
1152         * create it.
1153         */
1154        final PropertySpecImpl property;
1155        final TypeName propertyType;
1156        if( configuration.hasProperty( propertyName ) )
1157        {
1158            try
1159            {
1160                property = (PropertySpecImpl) configuration.getProperty( propertyName ).orElseThrow();
1161            }
1162            catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1163            {
1164                throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
1165            }
1166            propertyType = property.getPropertyType();
1167
1168            //---* The property type must match the setter argument type *-----
1169            if( !propertyType.equals( TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() ) ) )
1170            {
1171                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_TypeMismatch, TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() ).toString(), setterMethodName, propertyType.toString() ) );
1172            }
1173        }
1174        else
1175        {
1176            property = new PropertySpecImpl( propertyName );
1177            configuration.addProperty( property );
1178            propertyType = TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() );
1179            property.setPropertyType( propertyType );
1180        }
1181
1182        //---* Immutable special properties may not have a setter *------------
1183        if( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
1184        {
1185            property.getSpecialPropertyType()
1186                .map( CodeGenerator::getSpecialPropertySpecification )
1187                .filter( spec -> spec.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE ) )
1188                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalMutator, propertyName ) ) );
1189        }
1190
1191        //---* There is a setter, so the property is mutable *-----------------
1192        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
1193        if( configuration.getSynchronizationRequired() ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION );
1194
1195        //---* Keep the name of the setter method *----------------------------
1196        property.setSetterMethodName( setterMethodName );
1197
1198        //---* Shall the property be added to the result of toString()? *------
1199        if( nonNull( setter.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
1200        {
1201            property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
1202        }
1203
1204        /*
1205         * Default setters are handled differently, and they must have a
1206         * corresponding default getter.
1207         */
1208        final var isDefault = setter.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
1209        if( isDefault)
1210        {
1211            if( property.getGetterMethodName().isEmpty() || !property.hasFlag( GETTER_IS_DEFAULT ) )
1212            {
1213                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_MissingGetter, propertyName ) );
1214            }
1215            property.setFlag( SETTER_IS_DEFAULT );
1216        }
1217
1218        /*
1219         * If this setter is for a special property, we need to check whether
1220         * we have a getter, and whether that getter is for the same special
1221         * property.
1222         */
1223        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
1224        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
1225        {
1226            /*
1227             * A default setter cannot be a setter for a special property.
1228             */
1229            if( isDefault ) throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, SpecialProperty.class.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1230
1231            final var specialPropertyType = specialPropertyAnnotation.value();
1232            final var specialPropertyTypeOptional = property.getSpecialPropertyType();
1233            if( specialPropertyTypeOptional.isEmpty() )
1234            {
1235                /*
1236                 * No further analysis required because everything is
1237                 * determined by the special property spec, even the property
1238                 * name.
1239                 */
1240                property.setSpecialPropertyType( specialPropertyType );
1241            }
1242            else
1243            {
1244                if( specialPropertyTypeOptional.get() != specialPropertyType )
1245                {
1246                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_SpecialPropertyMismatch, SpecialProperty.class.getName(), setterMethodName, specialPropertyType.name(), specialPropertyTypeOptional.get().name() ) );
1247                }
1248            }
1249        }
1250        else
1251        {
1252            //---* Process the preferences annotations *-----------------------
1253            final var noPreferenceAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( NoPreference.class );
1254            final var preferenceAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( Preference.class );
1255            final var allowsPreferences = isNull( noPreferenceAnnotation );
1256
1257            if( nonNull(  preferenceAnnotation ) && nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1258            {
1259                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_PreferenceAnnotationClash, noPreferenceAnnotation );
1260            }
1261
1262            /*
1263             * If there is a getter for the property, the configuration for
1264             * preferences is already made there.
1265             * For a setter, the preferences annotations are only allowed if
1266             * there is no getter.
1267             */
1268            if( property.getGetterMethodName().isPresent() )
1269            {
1270                /*
1271                 * For a setter, the preferences annotations are only allowed
1272                 * if there is no getter.
1273                 */
1274                if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) || nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1275                {
1276                    final var a = nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) ? preferenceAnnotation : noPreferenceAnnotation;
1277                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, a.getClass().getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1278                }
1279            }
1280            else
1281            {
1282                if( allowsPreferences )
1283                {
1284                    property.setFlag( ALLOWS_PREFERENCES );
1285
1286                    //---* The default values *--------------------------------
1287                    var preferenceKey = propertyName;
1288                    var accessorClass = PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1289
1290                    //---* Check the annotation *------------------------------
1291                    if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1292                    {
1293                        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( preferenceAnnotation.key() ) ) preferenceKey = preferenceAnnotation.key();
1294
1295                        try
1296                        {
1297                            final var name = "accessor";
1298                            accessorClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( setter, Preference.class, name )
1299                                .map( TypeName::from )
1300                                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, Preference.class.getName(), name ) ) );
1301                        }
1302                        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1303                        {
1304                            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, Preference.class.getName() ), e );
1305                        }
1306                    }
1307
1308                    //---* Translate the default, if required *--------------------
1309                    accessorClass = retrieveAccessorClass( accessorClass, propertyType );
1310
1311                    //---* Keep the values *-----------------------------------
1312                    property.setPrefsKey( preferenceKey );
1313                    property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1314                }
1315            }
1316
1317            /*
1318             * Determine the string converter instance, either from the
1319             * annotation or guess it from the property type.
1320             */
1321            final var stringConverterOptional = configuration.determineStringConverterClass( setter, propertyType );
1322            property.getStringConverterClass()
1323                .ifPresentOrElse( stringConverterClass ->
1324                {
1325                    final var e = new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_StringConverterMismatch, setterMethodName ) );
1326                    if( !stringConverterClass.equals( stringConverterOptional.orElseThrow( () -> e ) ) ) throw e;
1327                },
1328                () -> stringConverterOptional.ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass ) );
1329
1330            //---* Configure the setter *--------------------------------------
1331            final var checkEmptyAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( CheckEmpty.class );
1332            final var checkNullAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( CheckNull.class );
1333
1334            /*
1335             * The annotations @CheckEmpty and @CheckNull are mutually
1336             * exclusive, although non-empty forces also not-null.
1337             */
1338            if( nonNull( checkNullAnnotation ) && nonNull( checkEmptyAnnotation ) )
1339            {
1340                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckNull.class.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1341            }
1342            if( nonNull( checkEmptyAnnotation ) )
1343            {
1344                if( isDefault )
1345                {
1346                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckEmpty.class.getName(), setter.getSimpleName() ) );
1347                }
1348                property.setFlag( SETTER_CHECK_EMPTY );
1349            }
1350            if( nonNull( checkNullAnnotation ) )
1351            {
1352                if( isDefault )
1353                {
1354                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckNull.class.getName(), setter.getSimpleName() ) );
1355                }
1356                property.setFlag( SETTER_CHECK_NULL );
1357            }
1358        }
1359
1360        //---* Create the setter's argument *----------------------------------
1361        final var argumentName = composeArgumentName( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ) );
1362        property.setSetterArgumentName( argumentName );
1363
1364        //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *---------------------------
1365        final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer().overridingMethodBuilder( setter )
1366            .addAnnotation( Override.class );
1367        property.setSetterBuilder( methodBuilder );
1368    }   //  handleSetter()
1369
1370    /**
1371     *  Determines whether the given instance of
1372     *  {@link TypeName}
1373     *  is for an {@code Enum} type.
1374     *
1375     *  @note  This requires that the class that is represented by the
1376     *      {@code typeName} argument exists on the {@code CLASSPATH}.
1377     *
1378     *  @param  typeName    The {@code TypeName} to check.
1379     *  @return {@code true} if the given type is an {@code Enum} type,
1380     *      {@code false} otherwise.
1381     */
1382    private final boolean isEnumType( final TypeName typeName )
1383    {
1384        var retValue = false;
1385        if( typeName instanceof ClassName className )
1386        {
1387            try
1388            {
1389                final var candidateClass = Class.forName( className.canonicalName(), false, getClass().getClassLoader() );
1390                retValue = candidateClass.isEnum();
1391            }
1392            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e )
1393            {
1394                /*
1395                 * Deliberately ignored; return value is already set.
1396                 */
1397            }
1398        }
1399
1400        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1401        return retValue;
1402    }   //  isEnumType()
1403
1404    /**
1405     *  <p>{@summary Parses the given CLI annotation and updates the given
1406     *  property accordingly.}</p>
1407     *  <p>{@code annotation} may be only of type
1408     *  {@link Argument}
1409     *  or
1410     *  {@link Option},
1411     *  although this is not explicitly checked (the method is private!).</p>
1412     *  <p>Usually, the method is only called by the methods
1413     *  {@link #parseArgumentAnnotation(Argument, ExecutableElement, PropertySpecImpl)}
1414     *  and
1415     *  {@link #parseOptionAnnotation(Option, ExecutableElement, PropertySpecImpl)},
1416     *  with the proper arguments.</p>
1417     *
1418     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1419     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1420     *  @param  property    The property.
1421     */
1422    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1423    private final void parseCLIAnnotation( final Annotation annotation, @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" ) final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1424    {
1425        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( method, annotation.getClass() )
1426            .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, annotation.getClass().getName() ) ) );
1427
1428        //---* The value handler class *---------------------------------------
1429        {
1430            final var name = "handler";
1431            final var annotationValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1432                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, annotation.getClass().getName(), name ) ) );
1433            final var handlerClass = TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
1434            property.setCLIValueHandlerClass( handlerClass );
1435        }
1436
1437        //---* The format *----------------------------------------------------
1438        {
1439            final var name = "format";
1440            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1441                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1442                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIFormat( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1443        }
1444
1445        //---* The meta var *--------------------------------------------------
1446        {
1447            final var name = "metaVar";
1448            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1449                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1450                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIMetaVar( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1451        }
1452
1453        //---* The multi-valued flag *-----------------------------------------
1454        {
1455            final var name = "multiValued";
1456            final var flag = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1457                .map( v -> (Boolean) v.getValue() )
1458                .orElse( FALSE )
1459                .booleanValue();
1460            if( flag ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_CLI_MULTIVALUED );
1461        }
1462
1463        //---* The required flag *---------------------------------------------
1464        {
1465            final var name = "required";
1466            final var flag = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1467                .map( v -> (Boolean) v.getValue() )
1468                .orElse( FALSE )
1469                .booleanValue();
1470            if( flag ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_CLI_MANDATORY );
1471        }
1472
1473        //---* The usage text *------------------------------------------------
1474        {
1475            final var name = "usage";
1476            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1477                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1478                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIUsage( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1479        }
1480
1481        //---* The usage text *------------------------------------------------
1482        {
1483            final var name = "usageKey";
1484            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1485                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1486                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIUsageKey( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1487        }
1488    }   //  parseCLIAnnotation()
1489
1490    /**
1491     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1492     *
1493     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1494     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1495     *  @param  property    The property.
1496     */
1497    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1498    private final void parseArgumentAnnotation( final Argument annotation, final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1499    {
1500        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT );
1501
1502        //---* The index *-----------------------------------------------------
1503        property.setCLIArgumentIndex( annotation.index() );
1504
1505        //---* The other fields *----------------------------------------------
1506        parseCLIAnnotation( annotation, method, property );
1507    }   //  parseOptionAnnotation()
1508
1509    /**
1510     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1511     *
1512     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1513     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1514     *  @param  property    The property.
1515     */
1516    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1517    private final void parseOptionAnnotation( final Option annotation, final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1518    {
1519        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_OPTION );
1520
1521        //---* The name and aliases *------------------------------------------
1522        final List<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
1523        names.add( annotation.name() );
1524        names.addAll( asList( annotation.aliases() ) );
1525        property.setCLIOptionNames( names );
1526
1527        //---* The other fields *----------------------------------------------
1528        parseCLIAnnotation( annotation, method, property );
1529    }   //  parseOptionAnnotation()
1530
1531    /**
1532     *  {@inheritDoc}
1533     */
1534    @Override
1535    public final boolean process( final Set<? extends TypeElement> annotations, final RoundEnvironment roundEnvironment )
1536    {
1537        //---* Tell them who we are *------------------------------------------
1538        final var message = annotations.isEmpty() ? "No annotations to process" : annotations.stream()
1539            .map( TypeElement::getQualifiedName )
1540            .collect( joining( "', '", "Processing the annotation" + (annotations.size() > 1 ? "s '" : " '"), "'" ) );
1541        printMessage( NOTE, message );
1542
1543        final var retValue = !roundEnvironment.errorRaised() && !annotations.isEmpty();
1544        if( retValue )
1545        {
1546            if( !annotations.isEmpty() )
1547            {
1548                /*
1549                 * Get the values for the i18n annotations and keep them.
1550                 */
1551                //---* Get the message prefix *--------------------------------
1552                m_MessagePrefix = retrieveAnnotatedField( annotations, roundEnvironment, MessagePrefix.class )
1553                    .filter( variableElement -> variableElement.getModifiers().containsAll( Set.of( PUBLIC, STATIC ) ) )
1554                    .map( variableElement -> format( "%s.%s", variableElement.getEnclosingElement(), variableElement.getSimpleName() ) );
1555
1556                //---* Get the base bundle name *------------------------------
1557                m_BaseBundleName = retrieveAnnotatedField( annotations, roundEnvironment, BaseBundleName.class )
1558                    .filter( variableElement -> variableElement.getModifiers().containsAll( Set.of( PUBLIC, STATIC ) ) )
1559                    .map( variableElement -> format( "%s.%s", variableElement.getEnclosingElement(), variableElement.getSimpleName() ) );
1560
1561                /*
1562                 * Process the elements that are annotated as configuration
1563                 * bean specification. Although not more than one per
1564                 * application seems logical, it could easily be more than one.
1565                 */
1566                ScanLoop: for( final var element : roundEnvironment.getElementsAnnotatedWith( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class ) )
1567                {
1568                    /*
1569                     * We are only interested in elements that are type
1570                     * elements, and to be honest, we only want interfaces.
1571                     */
1572                    if( element instanceof TypeElement typeElement )
1573                    {
1574                        if( typeElement.getKind() == ElementKind.INTERFACE )
1575                        {
1576                            //---* Create the configuration bean *-------------
1577                            try
1578                            {
1579                                processConfigurationBeanSpecification( typeElement );
1580                            }
1581                            catch( final IOException e )
1582                            {
1583                                printMessage( ERROR, e.toString(), element );
1584                            }
1585                        }
1586                        else
1587                        {
1588                            printMessage( ERROR, format( "%s: Only interfaces may be annotated with '%s'", typeElement.getQualifiedName().toString(), ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getSimpleName() ), element );
1589                            throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_InterfacesOnly, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1590                        }
1591                    }
1592                    else
1593                    {
1594                        printMessage( ERROR, format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationUse, element.getSimpleName().toString(), ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getSimpleName() ), element );
1595                        throw new IllegalAnnotationError( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1596                    }
1597                }   //  ScanLoop:
1598            }
1599        }
1600
1601        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1602        return retValue;
1603    }   //  process()
1604
1605    /**
1606     *  Processes the given configuration bean specification and generates the
1607     *  source for the so specified configuration bean.
1608     *
1609     *  @param  specification   The specification interface.
1610     *  @throws IOException A problem occurred when writing the source file.
1611     */
1612    private final void processConfigurationBeanSpecification( final TypeElement specification ) throws IOException
1613    {
1614        //---* Create the composer *-------------------------------------------
1615        final var composer = new JavaComposer( LAYOUT_FOUNDATION, addDebugOutput() );
1616
1617        final var specificationAnnotation = specification.getAnnotation( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1618
1619        //---* Determine the simple name of the bean class *-------------------
1620        final var configurationBeanClassName = getElementUtils().getName( isEmpty( specificationAnnotation.name() ) ? format( "%sImpl", specification.getSimpleName() ) : specificationAnnotation.name() );
1621        final var isSamePackage = specificationAnnotation.samePackage();
1622
1623        //---* Do we need to synchronise the access to the properties? *-------
1624        final var synchronizeAccess = specificationAnnotation.synchronizeAccess();
1625
1626        //---* Get the base class *--------------------------------------------
1627        TypeName baseClass = null;
1628        try
1629        {
1630            final var annotationValueName = "baseClass";
1631            baseClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( specification, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class, annotationValueName )
1632                .map( TypeName::from )
1633                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getName(), annotationValueName ) ) );
1634        }
1635        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1636        {
1637            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getName() ), e );
1638        }
1639        if( TypeName.from( Object.class ).equals( baseClass ) )
1640        {
1641            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
1642            baseClass = null;
1643        }
1644
1645        /*
1646         * Determine the name of the package for the bean class. As the
1647         * interface may be an inner type, we cannot just take the next best
1648         * enclosing element.
1649         */
1650        var parentElement = specification;
1651        while( parentElement.getNestingKind() != NestingKind.TOP_LEVEL )
1652        {
1653            parentElement = (TypeElement) specification.getEnclosingElement();
1654        }
1655        final var packageElement = (PackageElement) specification.getEnclosingElement();
1656        final var specificationPackageName = packageElement.getQualifiedName().toString();
1657        final var configurationBeanPackageName = getElementUtils().getName
1658            (
1659                isSamePackage
1660                ? specificationPackageName
1661                : packageElement.isUnnamed()
1662                  ? PACKAGE_NAME
1663                  : format( "%s.%s", specificationPackageName, PACKAGE_NAME )
1664            );
1665
1666        //---* Create the configuration for the code generation *--------------
1667        final var specificationClass = ClassName.from( specification );
1668        final var configuration = new CodeGenerationConfiguration( this, composer, specificationClass, configurationBeanClassName, configurationBeanPackageName, baseClass, synchronizeAccess );
1669
1670        //---* Determine the name for the initialisation data resource *-------
1671        var initDataResource = specificationAnnotation.initDataResource();
1672        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( initDataResource ) )
1673        {
1674            if( "=".equals( initDataResource ) ) initDataResource = format( "%s.properties", specification.getSimpleName() );
1675            configuration.setInitDataResource( initDataResource );
1676        }
1677
1678        //---* Retrieve the method for the initialisation *--------------------
1679        retrieveInitDataMethod( configuration, specification );
1680
1681        /*
1682         * Retrieve all the interfaces that are implemented by the
1683         * specification.
1684         */
1685        final Set<TypeElement> interfaces = new HashSet<>();
1686        retrieveInterfaces( specification, interfaces );
1687        final var interfacesTypes = interfaces.stream()
1688            .map( element -> TypeName.from( element.asType() ) )
1689            .collect( Collectors.toList() );
1690        configuration.addInterfacesToImplement( interfacesTypes );
1691
1692        //---* Retrieve the properties *---------------------------------------
1693        retrieveProperties( configuration, interfaces );
1694
1695        //---* Add the settings for the I18nSupport *--------------------------
1696        if( configuration.implementInterface( I18nSupport.class ) )
1697        {
1698            configuration.setI18NParameters( m_MessagePrefix.orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( MSG_NoMessagePrefix ) ),
1699                m_BaseBundleName.orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( MSG_NoBaseBundleName ) ) );
1700        }
1701
1702        //---* Determine the settings for the preferences stuff *--------------
1703        final var preferencesRootAnnotation = specification.getAnnotation( PreferencesRoot.class );
1704        if( nonNull( preferencesRootAnnotation ) )
1705        {
1706            configuration.setPreferencesRoot( preferencesRootAnnotation.nodeName() );
1707            try
1708            {
1709                getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( specification, PreferencesRoot.class, "changeListenerClass" )
1710                    .map( TypeName::from )
1711                    .ifPresent( configuration::setPreferenceChangeListenerClass );
1712            }
1713            catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1714            {
1715                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, PreferencesRoot.class.getName() ), e );
1716            }
1717        }
1718
1719        //---* Determine the settings for the {@code INI} file stuff *---------
1720        final var iniFileConfig = specification.getAnnotation( INIFileConfig.class );
1721        if( nonNull( iniFileConfig ) )
1722        {
1723            final Path path;
1724            try
1725            {
1726                path = PathStringConverter.INSTANCE.fromString( iniFileConfig.path() );
1727            }
1728            catch( final IllegalArgumentException e )
1729            {
1730                throw new CodeGenerationError( MSG_INIPathMissing, e );
1731            }
1732            if( isNull( path ) )
1733            {
1734                throw new CodeGenerationError( MSG_INIPathMissing );
1735            }
1736            configuration.setINIFileConfig( path, iniFileConfig.mustExist(), iniFileConfig.comment() );
1737            for( final var group : specification.getAnnotationsByType( INIGroup.class ) ) configuration.addINIGroup( group );
1738        }
1739
1740        //---* Retrieve the properties *---------------------------------------
1741        retrieveProperties( configuration, interfaces );
1742
1743        //---* Create the source code *----------------------------------------
1744        try
1745        {
1746            final var generator = new CodeGenerator( configuration );
1747            final var javaFile = generator.createCode();
1748
1749            //---* Write the source file *-------------------------------------
1750            javaFile.writeTo( getFiler() );
1751        }
1752        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyBroadCatchBlock" ) final Exception e )
1753        {
1754            /*
1755             * Any exception that makes it to this point indicates a failure of
1756             * the code generation process.
1757             */
1758            printMessage( ERROR, format( "Code Generation failed: %s", e.getMessage() ), specification );
1759            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CodeGenerationFailed, configurationBeanPackageName, configurationBeanClassName ), e );
1760        }
1761    }   //  processConfigurationBeanSpecification()
1762
1763    /**
1764     *  Retrieves the class for the preference accessor.
1765     *
1766     *  @param  accessorType    The accessor class as defined in the
1767     *      annotation; if this is
1768     *      {@link PreferenceAccessor PreferenceAccessor.class},
1769     *      the effective handler class has to inferred from the
1770     *      {@code propertyType}.
1771     *  @param  propertyType    The type of the property that should be
1772     *      accessed.
1773     *  @return The effective accessor class.
1774     *  @throws IllegalAnnotationError  There is no accessor for the given
1775     *      property type.
1776     */
1777    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.1" )
1778    private final TypeName retrieveAccessorClass( final TypeName accessorType, final TypeName propertyType ) throws IllegalAnnotationError
1779    {
1780        var retValue = accessorType;
1781        if( accessorType.equals( PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE ) )
1782        {
1783            //---* Infer the effective accessor class from the property type *-
1784            if( isEnumType( propertyType ) )
1785            {
1786                retValue = ENUM_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1787            }
1788            else
1789            {
1790                retValue = switch( CollectionKind.determine( propertyType ) )
1791                {
1792                    case NO_COLLECTION ->
1793                    {
1794                        final var c = m_PrefsAccessorClasses.get( propertyType.toString() );
1795                        yield nonNull( c ) ? ClassName.from( c ) : DEFAULT_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1796                    }
1797
1798                    case LIST -> LIST_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1799                    case MAP -> MAP_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1800                    case SET -> SET_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1801                };
1802            }
1803        }
1804
1805        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1806        return retValue;
1807    }   //  retrieveAccessorClass()
1808
1809    /**
1810     *  <p>{@summary This methods checks whether the configuration bean
1811     *  specification specifies an {@code initData()} method.} This method has
1812     *  to meet the requirements below:</p>
1813     *  <ul>
1814     *  <li>the name has to be
1815     *  {@value #METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_InitData}</li>
1816     *  <li>it does not take any arguments</li>
1817     *  <li>it returns an instance of {@code Map<String,Object>}</li>
1818     *  <li>it is either {@code static} or {@code default} or implemented in a
1819     *  base class, although this is not checked here</li>
1820     *  </ul>
1821     *  <p>Is such a method exists, a
1822     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.MethodSpec}
1823     *  for it will be created and added to the configuration.</p>
1824     *
1825     *  @param  configuration   The configuration for the code generation.
1826     *  @param  specification   The configuration bean specification interface.
1827     *
1828     *  @note   If a base class for the new configuration bean is defined, the
1829     *      method may be abstract, but if that base class does not implement
1830     *      the method it will be detected only by the final compiler run, not
1831     *      by the code generation here.
1832     */
1833    @SuppressWarnings( {"TypeMayBeWeakened", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1834    private final void retrieveInitDataMethod( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final TypeElement specification )
1835    {
1836        final var hasBaseClass = configuration.getBaseClass().isPresent();
1837        final var returnType = ParameterizedTypeName.from( Map.class, String.class, Object.class );
1838        final var method = specification.getEnclosedElements().stream()
1839            // We are only interested in methods.
1840            .filter( e -> e.getKind() == METHOD )
1841            // Methods are executable elements
1842            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
1843            /*
1844             * The method has to be either default or static; these modifiers
1845             * are mutually exclusive, so the method has either one or the
1846             * other, or it is abstract, having neither of default or static.
1847             */
1848            .filter( e -> hasBaseClass || e.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT ) || e.getModifiers().contains( STATIC ) )
1849            // The name of the method should be "initData"
1850            .filter( e -> e.getSimpleName().contentEquals( METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_InitData ) )
1851            // The method may not take any arguments
1852            .filter( e -> e.getParameters().isEmpty() )
1853            // The return type has to be Map<String,Object>
1854            .filter( e -> TypeName.from( e.getReturnType() ) instanceof ParameterizedTypeName )
1855            .filter( e -> returnType.equals( TypeName.from( e.getReturnType() ) ) )
1856            .findFirst();
1857
1858        method.map( m -> configuration.getComposer().createMethod( m ) )
1859            .ifPresent( configuration::setInitDataMethod );
1860    }   //  retrieveInitDataMethod()
1861
1862    /**
1863     *  <p>{@summary Scans the configuration bean specification for the
1864     *  properties and stores the result to the configuration.}</p>
1865     *  <p>A property is defined primarily by the respective
1866     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.function.Getter getter}
1867     *  method with its annotations, but it is also possible to define it by a
1868     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.function.Setter setter}
1869     *  method only â especially when the configuration bean specification
1870     *  extends the interface
1871     *  {@link java.util.Map}.</p>
1872     *
1873     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
1874     *  @param  interfaces  The interfaces that have to implemented by the new
1875     *      configuration bean.
1876     */
1877    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1878    private final void retrieveProperties( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final Collection<? extends TypeElement> interfaces )
1879    {
1880        final var isMap = configuration.implementInterface( Map.class );
1881
1882        /*
1883         * Retrieve getters, setters and 'add' methods from the interfaces.
1884         */
1885        final Collection<ExecutableElement> getters = new ArrayList<>();
1886        final Collection<ExecutableElement> setters = new ArrayList<>();
1887        final Collection<ExecutableElement> addMethods = new ArrayList<>();
1888        interfaces.stream()
1889            .flatMap( i -> i.getEnclosedElements().stream() )
1890            .filter( e -> e.getKind() == METHOD )
1891            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
1892            .forEach( element ->
1893            {
1894                if( isGetter( element ) )
1895                {
1896                    /*
1897                     * There is a method Map.isEmpty(); if the configuration
1898                     * bean specification extends java.util.Map, this is not a
1899                     * property getter for the 'empty' property.
1900                     * If isMap == true, the method isEmpty() will be
1901                     * implemented elsewhere.
1902                     */
1903                    if( !element.getSimpleName().toString().equals( METHODNAME_Map_IsEmpty ) || !isMap )
1904                    {
1905                        getters.add( element );
1906                    }
1907                }
1908                else if( isSetter( element ) )
1909                {
1910                    setters.add( element );
1911                }
1912                else if( isAddMethod( element ) )
1913                {
1914                    /*
1915                     * There is a method ConfigBeanSpec.addListener() that is
1916                     * necessary for the listener management, and not an 'add'
1917                     * method for a property. Therefore, it will be implemented
1918                     * elsewhere.
1919                     */
1920                    if( !element.getSimpleName().toString().equals( METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_AddListener ) )
1921                    {
1922                        addMethods.add( element );
1923                    }
1924                }
1925            } );
1926
1927        /*
1928         *  Getters are to be processed first.
1929         *  This will create the properties that are stored in the
1930         *  configuration.
1931         */
1932        getters.forEach( getter -> handleGetter( configuration, getter ) );
1933
1934        //---* Process the setters *-------------------------------------------
1935        setters.forEach( setter -> handleSetter( configuration, setter ) );
1936
1937        //---* Process the 'add' methods *-------------------------------------
1938        addMethods.forEach( addMethod -> handleAddMethod( configuration, addMethod ) );
1939    }   //  retrieveProperties()
1940}
1941//  class ConfigAnnotationProcessor
1942
1943/*
1944 *  End of File
1945 */
